title: Xinyu Zhang@University of California San Diego
snippet: Xinyu Zhang is a professor at UC San Diego, working on wireless network architectures, mobile applications, and ubiquitous sensing systems. He has received several awards and published many papers on topics such as mmWave communication, 3D reflecting surfaces, and passive RFID.

title: Xinyu Zhang@University of California San Diego
snippet: Xinyu Zhang is a professor at UC San Diego, working on wireless and machine learning. He has published papers on topics such as mmWave sensing, IoT security, and millimeter-wave networking.

title: Xinyu Zhang@University of California San Diego
snippet: Xinyu Zhang is a professor at UC San Diego, working on wireless communication and networking, sensor systems, and human-computer interaction. His publications cover topics such as metasurfaces, mmWave, satellite networks, adversarial attacks, and neuromorphic radar.

title: Xinyu Zhang | Center for Wireless Communications
snippet: Zhang is a wireless networking and sensing expert who received the 2023 SIGMOBILE Rockstar Award. He works on millimeter-wave network systems and new sensing modalities, driven by novel computational models and programmable hardware platforms.

title: Xinyu Zhang | Computer Science - University of California, San Diego
snippet: Dept of Computer Science and Engineering University of California, San Diego 9500 Gilman Drive La Jolla, CA 92093-0404 U.S.A.

title: ‪xinyu zhang‬ - ‪Google Scholar‬
snippet: Xinyu Zhang is a researcher in statistics and econometrics at the Academy of Mathematics and Systems Science, Chinese Academy of Sciences. He has published 36 articles on model averaging, information criteria, and spatial statistics, with co-authors from various institutions.

title: Xinyu Zhang | San Diego Wireless Summit
snippet: Xinyu Zhang is an Associate Professor in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at UC San Diego. He works on wireless network architectures, protocols, and ubiquitous sensing systems, and has received several awards and honors for his research.
